error.signature: error[E0499]: cannot borrow `x` as mutable more than once at a time

verdict.summary: Two mutable borrows active simultaneously. Rust enforces exclusive mutable access.

dead_ends.action: Use unsafe to bypass the borrow checker
dead_ends.why_fails: Causes undefined behavior if two mutable references overlap

workarounds.action: Split the operation so only one mutable borrow exists at a time
workarounds.how:
let val = map.get(&key).cloned();
map.insert(key, transform(val));  // borrows don't overlap

workarounds.action: Use RefCell for runtime borrow checking when compile-time is too restrictive

frequently_confused_with.distinction: '[E0499]' indicates borrowing as mutable more than once, while '[E0382]' indicates use of a moved value (ownership violation).
